definition: to borrow or lend money/debit and credit items on a balance sheet
to lend/to borrow/by means of/to take (an opportunity)
to lend on interest/to borrow/a loan/leniency/to make excuses/to pardon/to forgive

sentences.english: That is, we have increased the supply of loanable funds.
sentences.chinese: 這將使我們的可借貸資金的供應增加。

sentences.english: They fear (and not that unreasonably) that this would give the debtor states less incentive to reform.
sentences.chinese: 他們沒有緣由地害怕這會致使借貸國家不思改革。

sentences.english: You will just have to grovel to the bank manager for a loan .
sentences.chinese: 你只得低聲下氣地向銀行經理借貸。

sentences.english: The nature of financial capital is money that is funding the activities of the loan.
sentences.chinese: 金融的本質就是貨幣資本即資金的借貸活動。

sentences.english: The asset bubble in the Anglo-Saxon world gave them the equity capital for borrowing.
sentences.chinese: 歐美世界的資產泡沫給了他們借貸的資本。

sentences.english: A debt-based security, like a bond, represents a loan for a set period of time.
sentences.chinese: 借貸證券，像是公債，相當於一種一段時間內的貸款。

sentences.english: Usury laws would cripple not only government debt, but also other forms of borrowing.
sentences.chinese: 反高利貸法阻礙的不僅是政府債務，還有其他的借貸。

sentences.english: EXAMPLE: The bank did not consider personalty when assessing the worth of the borrower.
sentences.chinese: 這家銀行在評估借貸人資產時不將動產考慮在內。

sentences.english: He also paved roads, repaired houses, made loans to people in trouble.
sentences.chinese: 他還築了路，修繕房屋，借貸給困難中的人。

sentences.english: The basic principle of double entry bookkeeping is that every transaction has a twofold effect.
sentences.chinese: 複式記賬法的基本原理是每筆交易都有借貸雙方。

sentences.english: Emerging economies, for the most part, avoided this disastrous over-borrowing.
sentences.chinese: 而新興市場經濟體大多避免了災難性的過度借貸。

sentences.english: The wicked borrow and do not repay, but the righteous have mercy and share.
sentences.chinese: 惡人借貸總不償還，義人卻常好施樂善。

sentences.english: The public interest would dictate that the banks should resume lending on attractive terms.
sentences.chinese: 公共利益會要求銀行重新以有吸引力的條款進行借貸。

sentences.english: It says the aim is to guarantee responsible lending to poor borrowers.
sentences.chinese: 它的目標是爲負責任地向貧困者借貸提供擔保。

sentences.english: Longer-term borrowing markets are still mostly shut.
sentences.chinese: 長期借貸市場仍然通路不暢。

sentences.english: Article 11 Joint ventures shall adopt debit and credit double entry bookkeeping.
sentences.chinese: 第十一條合營企業採用借貸複式記帳法。

definition: a loan/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/to provide a loan (e.g. bank)/to raise a loan (from e.g. a bank)
property/real estate/abbr. for 物業管理|物业管理[wu4 ye4 guan3 li3], property management
to lend on interest/to borrow/a loan/leniency/to make excuses/to pardon/to forgive
